org.jlinalg.field_p
Class FieldPBig

java.lang.Object
  org.jlinalg.RingElement
      org.jlinalg.FieldElement
          org.jlinalg.field_p.FieldP
              org.jlinalg.field_p.FieldPBig
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<IRingElement>, IRingElement
 class FieldPBig
extends FieldP

This class implements an element of Fp where p can be arbitrarily big by using BigIntegers.

Author:
Andreas Lochbihler, Georg Thimm

          If already computed, the multiplicative inverse of value.

Constant Field Values

value

private java.math.BigInteger value
The smallest nonnegative representant of the equivalence class in Fp.

inverse

private FieldPBig inverse
If already computed, the multiplicative inverse of value. null otherwise

Constructor Detail

FieldPBig

FieldPBig(java.math.BigInteger value,
          FieldPAbstractFactory factory)
Constructs a new element of Fp which is the equivalence class containing value.

Parameters:
value - Any representant of the desired equivalence class. Value is assumed to be in the range 1..(p-1). For internal use only.
factory - the factory producing elements in Fp (typically the caller of this constructor).

public FieldPBig invert()

                        java.lang.ArithmeticException
Computes the multiplicative inverse

Specified by:
invert in interface IRingElement
Specified by:
invert in class FieldP
Returns:
The multiplicative inverse
Throws:
InvalidOperationException - Thrown if trying to inverst 0.
java.lang.ArithmeticException - Thrown if value is is not relatively prime to p.

compareTo

public int compareTo(IRingElement o)
Compares this element with another element of the same field Fp. Note: This order does not respect addition or multiplication!

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<IRingElement>
Specified by:
compareTo in interface IRingElement
Specified by:
compareTo in class FieldP
Parameters:
o - The element to compare to
Returns:
-1, if this is less, 0, if they are equal, 1, if this is bigger
